intro: Mertensia ovalifolia, commonly known as the oval-leaf bluebells, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central America. It is characterized by its basal rosette of lance-shaped, dark green leaves and produces clusters of delicate, bell-shaped blue or violet flowers. The plant is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is known for its ornamental value in gardens. Mertensia ovalifolia is also valued for its ecological role in supporting pollinators like bees and butterflies.
